Perfect phone. Got it in December, trust me value for money. Keeps the health of the phone as you need not charge overnight. By the time one gets ready, the phone is pretty charged up for use. Cheers to Mclaren edition!!!!
Superb phone so far..

I bought OnePlus 6 in July ..so after using 8months I came to know that in the beginning camera was good but now it is not... earlier The UI was fast but now it's slow...the space is lot consumed by Android itself .my images and music and other data hardly go above 5gb but now my free space is 35gb out of 64...it never hangs .. battery charging speed is good around 1hr.from 10% to 95%..battery SOT IS 6HRS EARLIER IT WAS 8HRS...back is still as new and OnePlus 6 was great  value for money!!!  But McLaren edition can't justify it's price ...s10e is good competition for OnePlus 6t McLaren...I think s10e is better value for money as it gives water proofing, better display, flagship camera ,fast charger,better one UI ,Dolby sound,akg headphones,IR SECURITY, wireless charging,128gb storage with SD CARD SUPPORT,superslow mode 960p .etc

review_title: Honest review after 5 months of experience using it.
review_text: Definitely one of the best phones of 2018, charging is just lightning quick, camera overall is a 9/10 , unlocking overall is a 10/10, sound overall is a 8/10, display is a 9/10, processing is a 10/10, battery life is a 10/10, Bluetooth pairing is a 9/10, charging is a 10/10 and value for money is a 9/10. This is coming from a person who has used this phone for almost 5 months and personally I have not been able to find a lot of cons other than the headphone jack missing and not up to the level sound quality.

I am only listing the things I didn't like and solutions which I came across.Problem A:-If u connect ur JBL headset or any good one via connector the audio quality is not up to the point. U can hear the difference from other mobiles with 3.5 mm Jack.Solution A: One of the way is to buy a Sony Bluetooth walkman or any good one if u r a hardcore music enthusiast like me.Problem B: No notification LedSolution B:Install apps like Plus beat or Noled it is actually better than normal notification Led I think.Problem C: So many errors like crashing chrome , calls network problem etcSolution C: Update to the latest OS on the moment u receive ur 1+6t.Problem D: Speaker volume is 20% less compare to other 1+ devicesSolution D: Nothing U can do about it, volume is decent though.The device is a beast and it is more than value for money if u compare spec with other devices and their price

review_text: Nice phone. Very fast processor and awesome camera. Only slight problem is with ringerprint scanner. It takes a bit more time. But face recognition comes as an easy alternate. Image quality and pixels are also genuine. Gr8 product and worth it's price.

review_title: As a flagship it's worth buying
review_text: The in display fingerprint sensor looks attractive however it's not so fast..Also sometimes it takes too long and hence you have to unlock through pattern. Camera quality is worth appreciating. Amoled screen is too good. There can be some advancements in battery life as it drains too fast..Overall it's value for money kind of thing..

Using this handset since 2 months. I like the most about this phone is it's speed and fast charging. Overall it's a nice experience.
Good value for money and great on features.

For  rs40k you can't get a better phone than this.Display is impressive,CPU and GPU performance is top notch and given the build quality the phone feels premium.I wish the cameras were better but for this price  range one can't expect camera quality to be as good as a pixel3 or an iPhone.Daylight photos are excellent but this camera struggles in low light scenarios.For me its still a satisfying camera.Also the speaker quality is bit disappointing.Overall this phone has many pros compared to very few cons.I have to admit that op6t is the best value for money flagship smartphone right now.I highly recommend this phone.
One plus 6t is a an awesome device there are no lags and the oxsygen os is too good the interface to use is awesome and i am quiet happy with the device.

Value for money
Doesn't compete with Samsung though - not slash proof, no led indicator, no heartbeat etc sensors - this list is long. I had S7 edge hence the comparison.

Have been using it for the past 24 hrs, quite impressed with the smoothness of the OS, also the inhand feel of the device is quite robust. Battery backup is very good, getting around 7 hrs of screen on time. Charging speed is insane, I was able to charge from 10 to 90 in 1 hr. Camera is good during day time, during night time its ok, for better results during night try using gcam port. There are only two downsides imo with 6t,  first lack of 3.5 mm jack, second I felt the screen is slightly less bright. Although I feel these are small issues. Overall it's a grt value for money and at this price the best device

review_title: one of the best performance phone. loved it
review_text: value for money. Must go for this phone
Overall the best value for money

This phone is an all around performer. It excels well in all sections. Does the job for the money you pay.Rating:1) Camera - 7.5/10 ( 8/10 if google camera is installed).2) Screen- 9/103) Battery standby - 8/10 [ Average standby time- 38-42 hours ] [ Screen on time - 8-9 hours]4)Build Quality - 9/10 [ Looks gorgeous]5)Call Quality - 9/10 [ Good]6) FingerPrint sensor - 8/10 [ Performs well ]Cons:1) Lacks wireless charging even after Glass back.2) Lacks Ip certification [Not a deal breaker for me]3) Camera could have been better. I still don't understand how google pixel 3 performs well with single lens than the other smartphones in the industry. Default oxygen os camera app image processing algorithms have to be improved.4) Lacks SD card slot.5)Lacks stereo speakers [ Deal breaker ] although the single bottom firing speaker performs above average.Overall Rating : 8/10Verdict: Real Value for money smartphone with Oneplus Magic
